comment.author: 56105315@N07
comment._content: Fantastic photo. I see a rabbit too!

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: They all look hungry for business. I'd bet you could wander in there and be unable to resist leaving without having first bought something. I'd imaging their necks would be on the line if any of them 'failed' to make a sale. Shop assistant work was tough back then whatever they were selling, so I understand.

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: I am wondering if they are two separate businesses sharing the same premises?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/23885771@N03] And interesting demarcation of roles judging by clothes and where they posed? Accounts people in their cubby; butcher types to the right in full whites; storesmen/delivery people at the left?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: ....and must have been a very brrrr freezing place to work in during the colder months. No insulation in the roof space.

comment.author: 59941010@N06
comment._content: Excellent documentation of a moment in time. I love the tiny office in the corner with 3 people inside :)

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: Premises were where the boutique  Cummin's and Stone are now on the east side of Conduit Lane near the junction with High Street in Waterford

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/63844591@N04] Thanks, do you mean in that building, or just a building on that site? Streetview

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: This is in an area of Waterford known as Blackfriars. The Medieval Blackfriars abbey was right across the street from Flynns & Youngs.

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content:
Niall, 
Flynn's actually owned the big corner shop on High Street /Conduit lane as well. The shop in the picture is the actual Cummins and Stone premises converted.

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: There are a couple of photos taken outside Flynns & Youngs in the NLI catalogue this is one Outside Flynn & Young's - snapshot I have also seen an old postcard on eBay a while ago showing the outside of the shop and a view down the street. The original of it does not seem to be in the librarys catalogue unfortunately.

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: Is that a block of ice hanging up on the left side of the shot?
